intro: Podagrostis novogaliciana, commonly known as the Croatian grass or mountain grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually arranged in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. Podagrostis novogaliciana plays a role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
